item.title: Carmaker Stellantis joins forces with France's CEA for EV battery research
item.description: "We know that battery technology is poised for change. While we don't know exactly how it will change, we are committed to be at the forefront of this transformation. Internally, we are working around the clock placing multiple bets and exploring various technologies," Stellantis Chief Engineering and Technology Officer Ned Curic said.

item.description:
1. The first non-Galaxy phone with an overclocked Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 is here  Android Authority

item.title: Are NASA, Boeing Starliner Astronauts Really Stranded in Space? - Bloomberg - Bloomberg
item.description:
1. Are NASA, Boeing Starliner Astronauts Really Stranded in Space? - Bloomberg  Bloomberg
  2. Why Boeing’s Starliner still isn’t ready to return to Earth  NPR

  4. NASA shares good news about Boeing Starliner as Sunita Williams still in space  Hindustan Times
  5. Why NASA is delaying Starliner capsule's return to Earth  CBS News

item.title: 'AFRAID' trailer teases the world's creepiest AI home assistant
item.description: Sony has released the trailer for "AFRAID", a new horror/thriller from writer/director Chris Weitz about an AI assistant turning against its owners.

item.description: Bluetooth speaker deals are heating up ahead of Amazon Prime Day, with standouts from Sony, JBL, and Soundcore.

item.title: Scan and fax from the palm of your hand with this handy $47.99 app
item.description: A lifetime subscription to SwiftScan VIP can be yours for only $47.99 now through July 21, with promo code SAVENOW.

item.title: Take $90 off a Samsung soundbar and upgrade your summer sounds
item.description: Improve your entertainment system's sound with the Samsung 170W 2.1ch soundbar with wireless subwoofer, now only $109.99 (reg. $199.99).

item.description: Get 33% off this hidden camera-, bug-, GPS-, and RF-detector.

item.title: Save $19 on an Apple USB-C power adapter
item.description: Get a new, open-box Apple 67W USB-C power adapter for just $39.99.

item.title: Feast your eyes on the stunning images spacecraft captured this year
item.description: Spacecraft from NASA and other organizations captured rich imagery of our solar system in 2024, including views of Mars, Io, the moon, and Earth.
